text: Guys I’ve just seen the clone repeater field option when building a page. THIS IS AWESOME!!!!
yes! i was really happy too when i first saw it a couple of weeks ago :slightly_smiling_face:
i think i read that the clone feature might be implemented in other modules as well ( at least it is considered)

Good morning everyone! Today is the HubSpot Community Developer Meetup. We have a great day ahead of us, so much work has been put into making this event happen, it’s awesome to see this day finally here.

If you are attending in-person and are signed up for the event, this is a reminder the event is happening at HubSpot Offices
25 First Street
First Floor - Sullivan Room
Cambridge, MA 02141

If you are not attending in person, and not registered to be here in person, we have a live stream that will be available - link to the YouTube streaming channel is available on our landing page.

<https://devday.splashthat.com/>

On behalf of the events leadership team - This is an amazing developer community, and we’re so happy to be apart of it. We’re all geeks, we’re here to have a great time, make connections, and grow better together.
i am not attending but  will be attending via livestream. Looking forward to it!!

Anyone else seeing this when trying to edit a items in a repeater?
I saw it yesterday on one portal and it seemed to fix it's self, but now my colleague has the problem on a different portal and it's not resolving it's self, she contacted support and they just said ask the person who built the module (That's me) there's nothing wrong with the module, it's existed for months working fine
It has to do with local storage
Clear your local storage for the module your working on
I'm on a. Flight otherwise I'd show you
the local browser cache?
Inspect window
Click on resources
got it
Select local storage from sidebar
thanks
`localStorage['design-manager-ide:user-<userId>:portal-<portalId>:codemirror-session']`
If you search for the ID of the module you can just delete those
This data only keeps the tabs in your memory but will re-save when you refresh the browser again
Thanks
Yup
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1567515416009700>

I've cleared storage and it's still not working,
I even tried opening it in a different browser

Eventually had 2 seperate solutions, I had 4 repeater items by default, by deleting one and readding it it fixed the one, The other one HubSpot support fixed by moving the module around in the flexible column

Quick note, the HubSpot Community Developer Meetup is starting soon, tune in to the live stream:
<https://youtu.be/VpArzDy5ny4>
We're looking into issues editing repeaters on our end. I'll let you know when we have an update.
This should now be resolved.
#Hello
this looks really awesome. I like how you have the global partial content editor look different from the code editor.

So does anyone have a clever way of carrying out the tracking of HubSpot CTA’s minus the wait times for them to load on the page?  Am I able to just use what is rendered? Or is this like a unique id generated for the given conversion? I have a site with CTA’s at the top of a page that lead off to landing pages etc but these load so slow it’s seriously frustrating. :confused:
